page.title: 14LANGUAGE
page.content: Not very many people in Porthleven speak the Cornish language but we still use some of the dialect words like{grammersow}for a{woodlouse.}When you meet someone you would say{"All {right my cocker?",}if it was a boy and {"All right maid?",}if it was a girl. If you wanted to go for a walk you would go for a{turn up along or down {along,}up a hill or down a hill. If you wanted something to eat say a pasty you would say, Can I have an {oggy me'andsome?}Then suddenly if you get into a temper people would say{ {mazed}and if you were stamping when you were in a temper you would be{ {stanking.}If you were really happy and started to giggle you would be{ {grizzling}or{grinning. {
